meanings.definition: A small nail or tack used to fasten fabric or leather.
meanings.sent1: She used tackets to secure the hem of her dress.
meanings.sent2: The upholsterer hammered in tackets to hold the fabric in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the tackets, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: His words were like tackets, piercing through her heart.
meanings.sent5: The tackets gleamed in the sunlight, adding a touch of sparkle to the leather bag.

meanings.definition: A small, sharp-pointed nail with a broad, flat head.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used tackets to attach the wooden panels together.
meanings.sent2: I found a few loose tackets scattered on the floor of the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The tackets on the noticeboard held up the flyers with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like the sound of tackets being hammered.
meanings.sent5: The tackets on the old trunk were rusty, showing their age and history.
